review_title: Great Review for AIESEC in the Philippines
job_title: Team Member in Los Baños, Laguna
pros: Good opportunity, MaxiMize potential, Leadership engageMent
cons: Nothing currently because they provide quality experience!

pros: As an undergraduate, working under AIESEC provided me with opportunities to both develop new skills as well as expanding my network with people I have developed lifelong connections with. AIESEC has helped step out of my comfort zone and the freedom to fail and learn
cons: While AIESEC was rewarding for the most part, I was also an undergraduate at the time and I had to balance my academic studies along with external obligations.

job_title: Local Committee Vice President in Manila, Manila
pros: AIESEC really puts you out there to develop yourself. Embodying the 4 Leadership Qualities that AIESEC preaches, I really felt supported and motivated to work harder and develop myself more.
cons: There will always be moments of toxicness, but those are from the leaders who lead the organization.

job_title: Project Manager in Diliman, Quezon City
pros: Invested in development and continuous growth of people
cons: Short work terms and limited time

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Quezon City, National Capital Region

review_title: Local Executive Board member for two years
job_title: Local Committee President in Manila, Manila
pros:
Amazing room for growth, if you are proactive enough to grab these opportunities.
Network access is amazing; you can make international contacts and meet top tier business people.
cons:
Do not expect salary, subsidy or incentives as it is a non-profit.
Quick turnover of roles may not be enough for slower workers.

review_title: Best leadership experience for a young professionals
pros: Dynamic change management, lot of responsibilities, diverse working environment, lots of conferences and international opportunities, huge network of active and young leaders,
cons: super time consuming, doesn't go in pair with your studies

job_title: Vice President in Quezon City, National Capital Region
pros: Wide network of current and alumni aisecers
cons: Relationships may wane as alumni age
